page.title: 05Population
page.content: This block containing the village of Weston Patrick is rural with 5 working farms. It has a population of approx. 150 most of whom live in the village or in Powntley Copse a small private estate of detached houses set in a wood close to the main Odiham to Alton road. The village has many large carefully restored detached houses. Most occupiers have at least 1 car many have 2 or more. About 40%(60) of the people work. Over half of these are in commerce and less than 10% in agriculture reflecting the popularity of the area as a high priced commuter location. Roughly 13% are retired and 23%(35) are children all but 2 of whom go to school although the village itself no longer has its own school. Only 1 farm owner lives on his farm in the block and 1 farm manager.
